title: Tiramisu
preparation: Whisk egg yolks and sugar, then heat with milk until thickened; cool completely.
Whip heavy cream and fold it into the egg mixture.
Dip ladyfingers in coffee and layer them in a dish, alternating with the cream mixture.
Chill for at least 4 hours and dust with cocoa before serving.

title: Pizza Margherita
preparation: Preheat the oven to high heat and roll out the pizza dough.
Spread crushed tomatoes on the base and add sliced mozzarella.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly, then top with fresh basil.

title: Pasta Carbonara
preparation: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente; reserve some pasta water.
Sauté pancetta until crispy, then remove from heat.
Whisk eggs and cheese together, then combine with hot pasta and pancetta.
Add reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce; serve with black pepper.

title: Lasagna
preparation: Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions.
Layer noodles, meat sauce, béchamel, and mozzarella in a baking dish.
Repeat layers and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan.
Bake until golden and bubbly, then let it cool before slicing.

title: Risotto
preparation: Sauté onion in butter until soft, then add Arborio rice and toast for a minute.
Gradually add warm broth, stirring continuously until absorbed.
After about 18-20 minutes, stir in white wine and Parmesan until creamy.
Season to taste and serve immediately.

title: Osso Buco
preparation: Sear veal shanks in a pot until browned, then remove.
Sauté onion and carrots in the same pot until soft.
Return shanks to the pot, add wine and broth, and simmer until tender (about 1.5-2 hours).
Serve with gremolata on top.

title: Bruschetta
preparation: Toast slices of baguette until golden.
Mix tomatoes, garlic, basil, olive oil, and balsamic vinegar in a bowl.
Spoon the mixture onto the toasted bread.
Serve immediately as an appetizer.

title: Gelato
preparation: Whisk together milk, cream, sugar, and flavorings until dissolved.
Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Transfer to a container and freeze until firm.
Scoop and serve in cups or cones.
